Make sure to turn off the SMS app\'s notification in system settings to avoid double notifications.

If the SMS app enforces notification permission, you can keep it granted and turn off all notification channels instead.

For SMS, this app takes over SMS notifications, it only filters them, spam messages will still be present in the SMS app.

%s

Caller Name:
  The regex will match against the caller display name(CNAP).

In the call history log, the caller name will appear after the phone number in parentheses if it exists, like:
  12345 (Display Name)

Allow calls that have CNAP(Caller Name Presentation) information, which is a telecom feature that displays the caller\'s registered name (along with the phone number) on the recipient\'s phone screen during an incoming call.

For countries that enforce KYC-verified CNAP, calls that have a caller name are likely valid.

Block forwarded calls, they are usually spam.

%s

This is carrier specific, some carriers format forwarded calls as two numbers concatenated with an \"&\", such as 222&111.

In this format:
  - The first part (222) is typically the forwarding number.
  - The second part (111) is the original number.

There could also be 333&111 and 444&111, where the origin number remains the same and the forwarding number changes.

No need to change this if you don\'t see numbers containing the \"&\" character in the call history log.

%s

Options:

Raw
Query/report the raw number(222&111), if the API supports this format.

Original
Query/report the original number(111), this is a workaround for APIs that don\'t support the raw format.

Forwarding
Query/report the forwarding number(222).
